intro: Dunbaria cumingiana, commonly known as the Cuming's dunbaria, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
